awd_titl_txt: Chemical and Petrological Characteristics of Antarctic      H-chondrite Populations and Relationship to Non-Antarctic   H-chondrites
awd_abstract_narration: This award supports studies to obtain high precision bulk and trace             element and mineral chemistry data on a large suite of Antarctic                ordinary chondrite meteorites.  These data will serve the dual                  purpose of proper characterization of these samples and                         determination of the reality of resolvable compositional                        differences between Antarctic finds and non-Antarctic observed                  falls.                                                                                                                                                          This work will include high-precision instrumental neutron                      activation analysis studies of 25 elements in 24 Victoria Land H-               chondrites.  To eliminate run-specific analytical biases, H-                    chondrite falls will be included in each neutron activation run,                and to improve precision, each meteorite will be analyzed in                    duplicate.  The electron probe data will focus on the existence                 of additional ordinary chondrites with properties intermediate                  between those of established groups.  These data will help in                   determining the existence of additional ordinary chondrite                      groups.
